definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: I was frantic to finish the report on schedule.
sentences.chinese: 我十萬火急地要按預定時間完成報告。

sentences.english: The minge win order too eager to get a geography book.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩特地火急地想要取得一當地輿書。

sentences.english: We have a ten-point emergency act ion plan for america.
sentences.chinese: 我們對美國有一個十萬火急的行動計劃。

sentences.english: We are in dire need of help.
As soon as he hung up the phone, Franz rushed off to pick McCandless up.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗茲一掛上電話，就十萬火急地去接他。

sentences.english: I have never encountered a situation when I got a call or text that had to be answered immediately anyway.
sentences.chinese: 總之還沒遇到過十萬火急的電話或短信需要立即回覆。

sentences.english: We all hope that our effort is able to get maximal bringing back a report.
sentences.chinese: 十萬火急我們都希望我們的努力能夠得到最大的回報。

sentences.english: There are very few true emergencies in life.
sentences.chinese: 生活中真正十萬火急的事情並不多見。

sentences.english: To see her husband very worried look, Linwei initiative to help mend.
sentences.chinese: 看到丈夫火急火燎的樣子，林薇主動上前幫忙修車。

sentences.english: Do you think everyone will speak the same language in the future?
sentences.chinese: 十萬火急你認爲在未來每個人都說同一種語言嗎？

sentences.english: This is a signal of the urgent urgency from Field Army Headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 這是野戰軍首長拍來的十萬火急的電報。

definition: lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
see 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3]
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
to need urgently/to need doing without delay
to fret/to get impatient/to become anxious
